questions.text: Who was the founder of Mauryan Empire?
questions.explanation:
Chandragupta Maurya founded the Mauryan Empire.
Ashoka was his grandson and the greatest Mauryan ruler.

questions.text: Which Mughal emperor built the Taj Mahal?
questions.explanation:
Shah Jahan built the Taj Mahal in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
It is located in Agra.

India got independence on August 15, 1947.
This day is celebrated as Independence Day.

questions.text: Who is known as the 'Father of the Nation'?
questions.explanation:
Mahatma Gandhi is known as the 'Father of the Nation'.
His full name was Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi.

questions.text: Who was the first Prime Minister of India?
questions.explanation:
Jawaharlal Nehru was the first Prime Minister of India.
He served from 1947 to 1964.

questions.text: When did the Revolt of 1857 start?
questions.explanation:
The Revolt of 1857 started on May 10, 1857 in Meerut.
It is also called the First War of Independence.

Qutub-ud-din Aibak built the Qutub Minar in Delhi.
He was the founder of the Delhi Sultanate.

questions.text: Who was known as the 'Iron Man of India'?
questions.explanation:
Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel was known as the 'Iron Man of India'.
He united all princely states into India.

questions.text: Which period is called the 'Golden Age of India'?
questions.explanation:
The Gupta Empire period is called the 'Golden Age of India'.
This was a time of great progress in science, art and literature.

questions.text: Who was the first President of India?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Rajendra Prasad was the first President of India.
He served from 1950 to 1962.
